intro: Modecca aculeata, commonly known as the spiny mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its hairy, spiny stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Modecca aculeata thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in botanical gardens and natural habitats.
